comments.html:
Ivan, maybe we should coin a new phrase that means that a device/system is entirely ready to perform all of it's functions using IPv6 in the same way that it does using IPv4, in the manner that you have explained.

Maybe something like 'IPv6-equipped', 'IPv6-primed', 'IPv6-fit' or my personal favourite 'IPv6-ripe', although that could get confused with a certain RIR. What do you think?
comments.name: Dan Holme

comments.html: How about IPv6-capable being no to one or both of the above questions and IPv6-ready being yes to both.
comments.name: Duncan Maccubbin

comments.html: Don't even try to go there. Before you know, we'll have "IPV6-wholegrain" and "IPv6-organic", not to mention GreenV6.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Duncan, if we could agree on terminology and be able to force it onto the vendors' marketing departments, I wouldn't need to write posts like this one  :-E
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
